definition: Ren An (-c. 90 BC), Han Dynasty general, also called Ren Shaoqing 任少卿
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

to imprison
to dread punishment/afraid of being arrested for a crime

to plot to assassinate
to commit suicide to escape punishment
to kill oneself/suicide
variant of 恪[ke4]
to brag/popular/lovely

to frame sb/to accuse falsely
to loosen/to open

peaceful/solemn
